009package Ch17_EdgePreservingSmoothing;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.addToDialog;
012import static imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils.getFromDialog;
013
014import ij.ImagePlus;
015import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
016import ij.io.LogStream;
017import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
018import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
019import imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving.TschumperleDericheF.Parameters;
020import imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving.TschumperleDericheFilter;
021import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
022import imagingbook.common.ij.IjProgressBarMonitor;
023import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
024import imagingbook.common.util.progress.ProgressMonitor;
025
026/**
027 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the use of the Anisotropic Diffusion filter proposed 
028 * by David Tschumperle in D. Tschumperle and R. Deriche, Rachid, "Diffusion PDEs on 
029 * vector-valued images}", IEEE Signal Processing Magazine, vol. 19, no. 5, pp. 16-25 
030 * (Sep. 2002). This plugin works for all types of images and stacks.
031 * 
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2021/01/06
034 */
035
036public class Tschumperle_Deriche_Filter implements PlugInFilter {
037        
038        static {
039                LogStream.redirectSystem();
040                PrintPrecision.set(6);
041        }
042        
043        private static Parameters params = new Parameters();
044        
045//      private boolean isColor;
046
047        public int setup(String arg0, ImagePlus imp) {
048                return DOES_ALL + DOES_STACKS;
049        }
050        
051        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
052//              isColor = (ip instanceof ColorProcessor);
053                if (!getParameters())
054                        return;
055                
056                GenericFilter filter = new TschumperleDericheFilter(params);
057                
058                try (ProgressMonitor m = new IjProgressBarMonitor(filter)) {
059                        filter.applyTo(ip);
060                }
061        }
062
063        private boolean getParameters() {
064                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
065                addToDialog(params, gd);
066                
067                gd.showDialog();
068                if (gd.wasCanceled()) return false;
069
070                getFromDialog(params, gd);
071                return params.validate();
072        }
073        
074//      private boolean getParameters() {
075//              GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
076//              gd.addNumericField("Number of iterations", params.iterations, 0);
077//              gd.addNumericField("dt (Time step)", params.dt, 1);
078//              gd.addNumericField("Gradient smoothing (sigma_g)", params.sigmaD, 2);
079//              gd.addNumericField("Structure tensor smoothing (sigma_s)", params.sigmaM, 2);
080//              gd.addNumericField("a1 (Diffusion limiter along minimal variations)", params.a0, 2);
081//              gd.addNumericField("a2 (Diffusion limiter along maximal variations)", params.a1, 2);
082////            if (isColor) {
083////                    gd.addCheckbox("Use linear RGB", params.useLinearRgb);
084////            }
085//              gd.addMessage("Incorrect values are replaced by defaults.");
086//              
087//              gd.showDialog();
088//              if (gd.wasCanceled()) return false;
089//
090//              params.iterations = Math.max(1, (int)gd.getNextNumber());
091//              params.dt = (double) gd.getNextNumber();
092//              params.sigmaD = gd.getNextNumber();
093//              params.sigmaM = gd.getNextNumber();
094//              params.a0 = (float) gd.getNextNumber();
095//              params.a1 = (float) gd.getNextNumber();
096////            if (isColor) {
097////                    params.useLinearRgb = gd.getNextBoolean();
098////            }
099//              return true;
100//      }
101
102}
